column5: Their mouths get even bigger.
A beast! Congrats.
That's a beauty for sure
LMAO!    Thanks everyone!
Nice work. That's a beauty Largemouth.
Nice fish and LOL at Paul, Joey!!
Absolute hawg, Jamie!  Well done, have to love those submerged trees.
VERY nice fish there man....well done!
That's the same as my PB LM. I remember what a pig it was and how excited I was when I got mine, so good on you Stoty!
very nice dude... congrats
This story is painful to hear...
Congrats on your PB Were you able to get any measurements on that brute?  Just curious to know
Very nice fish1 A Hawg for sure!
It's still a baby compared to my overall PB of 9.6lbs, but don't think I'll be matching that up here anytime soon! Lol  Fish was (surprisingly) only 22" long but had quite the set of shoulders on it!
Wow, 9.6lbs is insane for up here!   It's not so much the length that matters but the girth.
The 9.6 was from Florida... 6.4 is my biggest LM up here, and 6.2 is my biggest SM.    That's what she said!
beauty!!!
Thanks!

Got out on Rice Lake with my buddy again yesterday, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable trips I've had on Rice! Lots of fish caught... but the reason for my excitement......  Broke my (Canadian) Largemouth Bass PB. My previous Cdn PB was 5.75 LM, but this one weighed in at 6.4lbs!!     Got it on a Flipping Jig with an Xzone Chunk Trailer in 8ft of water.
Beauty, looks like great cover to fish as well! I wonder how many more are in there?
Wow ! thats a large ass bass. Nice
Nice bass!!!!!!!!!!!!
That's a chunk Stots
Awesome congrats on a hawg
Very nice
That new boat just paid for itself in one hookset!!! Nice fish!
Awesome fish.  I just dont have the patience or confidence in flippin to stick with it.    Ian
Heavy duty fish! Congrats to you.

Really nice bass.  I'll tell ya a funny story.  Paul's parents had a cottage near Minden.  The lake was full of large mouth bass, and some biggies.  One night, we went fishing when the full moon was out.  It was a bit hard to see but Paul used a skitter pop and all of a sudden we hear this huge swirl and he had a big largie on.  It was the biggest largie I had ever seen.  We figured it might be a record.  We knew the record for Ontario was 10.43 lbs, so we took it up to the cottage and only had a human scale, so Paul stood on the scale, weighed himself, then weighed himself with the fish.  11 lbs.  Wow, we were thrilled.  So we kept it alive in our cooler with lake water, took it to Paul's parent's house the next day and his father was out of town, but his mom and nephew were there.  The nephew said he had a legal scale at work and would take it in to weigh it.  I called the next day and his father was back home.  I said, "did you see the fish Paul caught" and he said "Ya, it tasted like mud"  He thought we brought it to him to eat as we usually brought him fish after our fishing trips to eat  So could have been a record, we'll never know now!!!
WOW!!! what a pig !!! Congrats !
That's some great larg. Beauty!
Oh Man !!!!! Awesome fish.Dont be showin that to Ed, or he may be wantin his boat back
Great fish!  Congrats!
Thanks everyone!
Ughhhh! Did you at least get a picture of it?    Great bass Stoty, that thing is a real pig!
Nice fish!!
Wow. Simply awesome.
nice fish Jamie, I hope you find it again in the fall when it's packing on the LB's!
They're called "largeMOUTH"...you're looking at the wrong end.
That's what we call a B...B  BEAUTIFUL BASS............
I hope he doesn't thumb them!
Big fish for sure !!
Very nice Hawg!
